metadata.Title: CVE-2022-34470 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
Session history navigations may have led to a use-after-free andpotentially exploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 102,Firefox ESR < 91.11, Thunderbird < 102, and Thunderbird < 91.11.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-34470` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 102.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 102.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 102.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:91.11.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:91.11.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:91.11.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:91.11.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:91.11.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:91.11.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '102.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
thunderbird package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:91.11.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
